title: ‘Domestic act of terrorism’: Vehicle labelled ‘deadly weapon’ following ICE shooting
description: US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem claims vehicles used to hurt individuals are “deadly” weapons following an ICE shooting in Minnesota.  “It’s clearly established law that a vehicle driven by a person and used to hurt someone is a deadly weapon,” Ms Noem said.  “This domestic act of terrorism, to use your vehicle to try to kill law enforcement officers, is going to stop.  “I’m asking the Department of Justice to prosecute it as domestic terrorism.”

title: Woman shot by ICE ‘attempted to kill’ agents in Minnesota: Kristi Noem
description: US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem says the woman shot by an ICE officer in Minnesota “weaponised her vehicle”.  “This appears as an attempt to kill or to cause bodily harm to agents,” Ms Noem said.  “He was treated at a local hospital and has been released.”

title: James Allsop reportedly to run Bondi Beach Royal Commission
description: Sky News host Sharri Markson is reporting Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will be appointing Chief Justice of the Federal Court James Allsop to be the head of the federal Royal Commission into the Bondi attack.   Ms Markson reports Mr Albanese will make this announcement as early as today if the details are ironed out; otherwise, it will occur tomorrow.

title: Tasmania’s only Rabbi criticises Albanese government for lack of action on antisemitism
description: Chabad of Tasmania Rabbi Yochanan Gordon, Tasmania’s only Rabbi, has outlined what he hopes to see in a federal Royal Commission into antisemitism.   Rabbi Gordon has criticised the federal government for an apparent lack of action on antisemitism.   There are around 400 Jewish people in Tasmania, with Australia’s first synagogue established in Hobart in 1845.   “There are people here in Tasmania that want to legitimise violence in our community; it’s disgusting,” Rabbi Gordon said.   Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff has stated he supports a Royal Commission.

title: Karoline Leavitt torches Democrats for their ‘hypocrisy’ on Maduro capture
description: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt has blasted Democrats for their hypocrisy regarding their rhetoric regarding former Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro.  During a press briefing, Leavitt said taking down the "illegitimate" leader Maduo was a "bipartisan" issue.  The press secretary singled out Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer, referring to an old speech he made where he called Trump out for his inaction in Venezuela.  Leavitt then said that Schumer had long advocated for the removal of the dictator.

title: Minneapolis Mayor has unhinged meltdown, tells ICE to 'get the f*** out' after shooting
description: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey has launched an unhinged attack on Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) following a shooting.  Frey’s comments follow the lethal shooting of a 37-year-old woman in Minneapolis, Minnesota, by ICE agents during an immigration operation.  During an address on Wednesday, the mayor claimed he had seen the video of the shooting and labelled the self-defence claims by officials as “bulls**t”.  “They are already trying to spin this as an action of self-defence. Having seen the video of myself, I want to tell everybody directly. That is bullshit,” Frey said.  Mayor Frey then attacked ICE, asserting that the federal agents “get the f**k out of Minneapolis”.

title: Venezuela rumoured to have Hezbollah ‘terrorist’ training camps
description: ‘Triggernometry’ co-host Francis Foster details rumours of Hezbollah training camps in Venezuela.  “There are reports coming out of Venezuela, and there have been for a long time, that they have Hezbollah training camps,” Mr Foster told Sky News contributor James Bolt.  “Terrorists who go and attack America’s allies are being literally trained in Venezuela.  “They are literally being trained on America’s back door.”

title: Pete Hegseth unloads on CNN reporter for ‘disingenuous’ question
description: US Secretary of War Pete Hegseth has unleashed on a CNN reporter for their “disingenuous” question about the cost of recent military operations.  The question of military cost comes after the capture of former Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro and the seizure of two oil tankers linked to the country.  Hegseth accused the reporter of attempting to “undermine” one of the “most historic military missions the world has ever seen.”  The secretry of war goes on to say US President Donald Trump is not messing around, stating his administration is “one of action.”

title: Trump takes control of Venezuelan oil
description: The US intercepted two oil ships attempting to escape Venezuela's blockade, including one registered in Russia.  Authorities believe the vessel violated sanctions by carrying Iranian oil.  It's the latest escalation in the region, as the Trump administration steps up its efforts to control the sale of Venezuelan oil.

title: ‘Ushered into power’: Delcy Rodriguez rumoured to be in on Maduro’s capture
description: ‘Triggernometry’ co-host Francis Foster explains the rumour pertaining to Delcy Rodriguez’s involvement in Nicolas Maduro’s capture.  “There is a rumour in Venezuela that she was in on this,” Mr Foster told Sky News contributor James Bolt.  “All of the top dogs in Maduro’s cabinet all had bounties on their head, placed there by the American government, apart from Delcy Rodriguez and her brother, who was head of the senate.  “Why are they the only two people who didn’t have that?  “The rumours are that she was in on it from the start, which is why she was ushered into power.”

title: US-Colombia tensions escalate as Petro calls on supporters to mobilise
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro calls on his supporters to mobilise nationwide.  The call to the streets follows US President Donald Trump's remarks that a military operation against Colombia “sounds fantastic” to him.  Tensions in Colombia have escalated in response to the US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

title: PM ‘finally realises’ the pressure he is under to call a Royal Commission into antisemitism
description: Sky News host Freya Leach talks about how “fresh and so heartbreaking” the Bondi Beach tragedy still is.   “The last victim of the Bondi massacre, Peter Meagher, was farewelled today in a moving ceremony in Saint Mary’s Cathedral,” Ms Leach said.   “Noticeably, Anthony Albanese was there, but it was the first and only funeral he attended after members of the Jewish community apparently communicated to him that he should attend the others.   “I think he’s finally starting to realise how much pressure he is under to call a Royal Commission.”

title: ‘Inability to read the room’: PM under fire for only attending one funeral for Bondi victims
description: Former Liberal senator Hollie Hughes claims Prime Minister Anthony Albanese “isn’t responsive” to the Jewish community’s concerns and fears around antisemitism.   “Isn’t it interesting, though, that the one funeral that Albanese could bring himself to attend was not for one of the Jewish victims,” Ms Hughes said.   “I just think it’s indicative of this prime minister and his inability to read the room.”

title: ‘Twenty-five days of inaction’: Albanese blasted for ‘procrastinating’ on Royal Commission
description: Nationals MP Michael McCormack claims the former chief justice would be a “good appointment” as Commissioner amid speculation of a Royal Commission backflip.   “We’ve had twenty-five days of inaction, twenty-five days of procrastination from the Prime Minister,” Mr McCormack told Sky News Australia.  “The Jewish community deserves somebody of the calibre of James Allsop.”

title: JD Vance unveils Trump's master plan to put the ‘pressure’ on Venezuela
description: US Vice President JD Vance has unveiled Donald Trump’s master plan to control Venezuela.  In an upcoming sit-down interview with Fox News host Jesse Watters, Vance broke down how America is putting the screws to Venezuela.  “The way that we control Venezuela is we control the purse strings, we control the energy resources, and we tell the regime: you're allowed to sell the oil so long as you serve America's national interest,” Mr Vance said.  The VP also debunked claims that Venezuela has “nothing to do with drugs” on his X account.  This comes as Venezuelan government supporters marched in Caracas to demand the return of Nicolas Maduro.
